description: Making flexible items out of hard materials is tricky.  You've done enough of it to understand how to make smoothly articulated joints out of rigid or semi-rigid materials.
//: while specifically made for tailoring, I think this could also apply to things like making robot legs.  For tailoring this is mostly a speed boost skill.

description: You are familiar with the adjustments and tricks needed to make properly functional buttons, zippers, and other closures on garments.
You know how to making garments and fabric containers sealed against water.
Making elastic bands is easy enough, but making a whole garment from stretchy cloth takes a bit of finesse.  You're good at it.
Like a magical elf, you've learned how to construct footwear by hand.
The art of spinning fiber into thread.
//: In the future, having this proficiency could give a boost to learning rope making and vice versa

description: You've learned how to use a loom to produce sheets of fabric from thread.
Like a solitary mouse, you've learned how to construct hats by hand.
Knitting, one of the oldest ways of tying knots in fiber until it is fabric.
You have knitted and knitted and knitted some more, and have the consistent string tension to show for it.  When you get going, the clicking of your needles is like a metronome.
You've got a basic familiarity with how to work with leather, furs, hides, and similar materials.
Working with leather requires a specific set of skills and toolsâ€¦ a set you are familiar with.
Working with fur and faux fur is a skill all its own.
It seems unlikely that anyone prior to the cataclysm knew how to work with the shells of giant bugs as well as you do now.
//: Given that nobody has ever written a guide for this, it should be particularly tough to master.

description: Turning sheets of chain links into effective, wearable clothing that doesn't bind up.
You know the tricks for working with Kevlar, Nomex, and other advanced polymer cloth.
